name: wltest.py
short_description:
script to analyse portal images from linear accelerator regarding Winston-Lutz-Test (automatic analysis of an unlimited number of images):

1. script reads DICOM-RT file containing Winston-Lutz image data (sphere+mlc gradient information) 
2. x- and y-shift shift is calculated relative to beam direction
3. images with result are saved (see screenshots): green-passed (<0.75mm); yellow(0.75...1mm); red (not passed: >1mm)

python is needed with following packages:
import numpy as np
import pylab as plt
from scipy import interpolate
import dicom as dcm
import sys,os

you may adapt certain variables in the source code to make the script run with your images (regarding calculation of borders of MLC and sphere via derivative of image values), so please send a mail (hannes.rennau@uni-rostock.de).

With some minor updates in the code, the code should also work on .png or .jpg images if the image grid spacing (e.g. [mm]) is available.
summary: Analysis of images from Winston-Lutz Test (images in DICOM-RT format)
